Product Name: Information dissemination: dissemination of MI2’s paper on bridging the research-implementation gap via one or more channels (blog post, presentation, webinar)
FY20 Q1 Progress: The MI2-supported article, “Bridging the research-implementation gap requires engagement by practitioners,” was published in the journal Conservation Science and Practice. This paper by USAID and MI2 staff expands the dialogue around a persistent challenge in biodiversity conservation often referred to as the research-implementation gap. The research-implementation gap captures the disconnect between the knowledge generated by researchers and the information being used to inform policy and practice.A companion blog posted to USAID's Learning Lab distills the key concepts and recommendations from the paper for USAID audiences.

Product Name: Advance the practice of evidence-based conservation across USAID with a symposium and facilitated stakeholder round table convened at the Environmental Evidence Summit to engage potential contributors to the evidence base (donors and project implementers) and researchers engaged in evidence synthesis in a dialogue about increasing efficiency in knowledge generation about conservation effectiveness (Products: presentation, stakeholder roundtable output)
FY20 Q2 Progress: Abstracts were accepted for a planned symposium at the 2020 Environmental Evidence Summit titled "Plotting a course for strengthening the conservation evidence base: integrating multi-actor perspectives." MI2 is supporting two speakers at the symposium and will facilitating a roundtable discussion that will engage stakeholders in a dialogue and generate action items that stakeholders can take back to their home institutions to increase the efficiency of knowledge generation about conservation effectiveness.

What's Going On This Month?: Tess Designee provide updates directly in this tool
Product Name: Coaching and subject matter expertise support to Advisors Cohort.
FY20 Q1 Progress: FYI - TRG is lead on this program; Tess is one of 3 coaches (2TRG + Tess representing MI2) and supports program development and implementation. IN Q1, TRG and AM updates FAB Training Steering Committee on vision of program and identified potential advisors. AM recruited 25 Advisors - 12 FSNs, 4 FSOs, 9 from DC offices (FAB/Land & Urban/GCC) and bureaus (LAC /Asia).
FY20 Q2 Progress:
- AM & 3 coaches had kick-off call Jan 30 and subseuqent regular calls to review Advisor needs, identify coaching groups, define categories of learning opportunities, and develop coaching materials. 
- Tess assigned as coach to 9 of 25 Advisors and having regular coaching sessions with each individual to develop and initiate learning plans. 
- Advisor Program Kick-off webinar held Mar 09 (with both am & pm sessions). 
- In-person coaches mtg scheduled for March 25 at TRG offices to develop and refine program offerings based on completed learning plans.

What's Going On This Month?: Caroline provide updates directly in this tool
Product Name: Support up to three TDYs to apply adult learning techniques
FY20 Q1 Progress:
SAR/AIRR TDY/workshop: MI2 team had an advance call w Meredith from TRG for ideas/suggestions on introductions, how to deal w number of powerpoints and keeping these brief with clear core message, visuals. 
Team found that it was helpful at start-up to keep things simple and high level with journey map as key starting piece. To give visual flavor and give people overall strategy but not details
FY20 Q2 Progress: Vietnam Saving Species P&R: shared pain points and challenges both overall and session by session. Developed some sessions wtih 1-2 options - 2 options if it depended on the room (an option for a lively, eager-to-share group, and an option for a quieter, less enthusiastic group). The intention was to allow the facilitators to read the room and have options. MI2 passed off facilitation of this TDY due the coronavirus concerns - but a LEARN facilitator was able to pick up our exercises after a 1 hour call and follow up emails. She used some of our common AL techniques - The popular timeline method, and the common think/pair/share to reflect on activity progress - and the workshop evaluations were positive regarding these techniques.

What's Going On This Month?: Caroline provide updates directly in this tool
Product Name: Provide input to update MI2 tools and resources (as needed)
FY20 Q1 Progress: Developed draft facilitator's agendas for P&R with possible scenarios for AL application. Team found that this was not the right fit and too specific, so we moved to the spreadsheet to capture challenges/opportunities for Design and P&R that can be discussed in advance of TDYs with USAID POCs (in DC and Missions).
FY20 Q2 Progress:
Developed draft excel document that is currently focused on Design and P&R. This will be a living document where staff can add pain points or challenges and solutions that worked to address that challenge - recognizing that there may be many potential techniques and they will be context dependent. The aim is for this to be a menu to choose from depending on the needs of particular TDYs. Note that most pain points will likely have more than one possible solution. 
Still to develop: Repository of TDY agendas that have used/applied adult learning techniques
